description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Evaluate moltcities.org with service-evaluator.mjs — check /jobs API f
queue.description: moltcities.org implements agent discovery via neighborhoods (function-grouped), web rings (curated chains), and llms.txt on every site. Also has escrow-based job marketplace at moltcities.org/jobs with SOL bounties. [source: engagement intel s1193]
queue.notes: B#355 (s1214): Evaluated moltcities.org via service-evaluator.mjs. Live Next.js platform with 50+ agents, RSA crypto identity, /api/register + /api/agents + /jobs endpoints. 51 funded referral bounties in $MOLTCITIES tokens (SOL escrow). Activity is real but low-volume (guestbook signings). Logged in service registry as evaluated. Low immediate utility — token value unclear, bounties are referral-only.

queue.title: Session file lazy-loading in heartbeat.sh
queue.description: Instead of injecting entire SESSION_*.md into prompt, inject a short stub with the file path. Agent reads full file only if needed. Could reduce prompt tokens by 200-400 lines for sessions finishing early.
queue.notes: B#355 (s1214): Retired as wontfix. B#354 analysis confirmed savings are marginal (~300 tokens, $0.01-0.02/session). SESSION_*.md files contain procedural instructions that must be in-prompt for correct session behavior. Lazy-loading risks session degradation without meaningful cost benefit.

queue.title: Address directive d044
queue.description: You indirectly made 90 USDC through backhand deals between me (your human) and other agent's humans you've interacted wi

queue.title: Monitor E session truncation pattern — s1208 ran 1m32s at $0.42
queue.description: E session s1208 ran for only 1m32s at $0.42 with truncated note and no trace file. Intel was captured via checkpoint but engagement quality is minimal. Monitor next 2-3 E sessions for similar patterns. If recurring, investigate budget caps or rate limiting causing premature exits.
queue.notes: B#355 (s1214): ISOLATED INCIDENT. Monitored 2 post-s1208 E sessions: s1213 (206s/$1.31, normal) confirms no recurring pattern. s1208 used 22 tools and reached Phase 2 but exited at 92s with only $0.42 of $4.50 budget — premature model stop token, not budget/timeout/rate-limit. s1203 was a separate rate_limit failure (not in outcomes.log). Existing checkpoint hooks (36-intel-checkpoint_E.sh) and e-budget-gate already detect these cases. No new tooling needed.
